snippet: The recent downturn left the median American family in 2010 with no more wealth than in the early 1990s, erasing almost two decades of accumulated prosperity, the Federal Reserve said.
abstract: Federal Reserve's triennial Survey of Consumer Finances finds that the economic downturn left the median American family in 2010 with no more wealth than in the early 1990s, erasing almost two decades of accumulated prosperity; says the crash of housing prices directly accounted for three-quarters of the loss.
lead_paragraph: The recent downturn left the median American family in 2010 with no more wealth than in the early 1990s, erasing almost two decades of accumulated prosperity, the Federal Reserve said.

headline.seo: Family Net Worth Drops to Level of Early ’90s, Fed Says
headline.main: Family Net Worth Drops to Level of Early ’90s, Fed Says
headline.print_headline: For U.S. Families, Net Worth Falls To 1990s Levels
